thread.title: Kelly, Tillerson head to Mexico to repair relations after canceled meeting
thread.title_full: Kelly, Tillerson head to Mexico to repair relations after canceled meeting | Washington Examiner

author: Gabby Morrongiello
title: Kelly, Tillerson head to Mexico to repair relations after canceled meeting
text:
Secretary of State Rex Tillerson and Homeland Security Secretary John Kelly will travel on Wednesday to meet with Mexican President Enrique Peña Nieto as they look to ease tensions with the United States' southern neighbor and discuss the Trump administration's impending crackdown on illegal immigration .
The two members of President Trump 's Cabinet are slated to arrive in Mexico City in the early afternoon for discussions with Peña Nieto and several Mexican military and government officials.   Mexico and continue to collaborate on bilateral issues such as counterterrorism, trade and border security.
Trump had planned to meet with Peña Nieto last month, but the meeting was called off following repeated clashes between the two leaders over Trump's plan to build a wall along the U.S.-Mexico border.
"Unless Mexico will treat the U.S. fairly, with respect, such a meeting is fruitless, and I want to go a different route," Trump told Republican lawmakers at their annual retreat in Philadelphia this month.
Stay abreast of the latest developments from nation's capital and beyond with curated News Alerts   news desk and delivered to your inbox.

Tillerson and Kelly, both of whom are said to be working with the administration to write a revised executive order on immigration , will spend time with Mexican ministers of Foreign Relations, Finance and National Defense, in addition to their sit-down with Peña Nieto.
The trip marks the first time senior administration officials will meet with their Mexican counterparts since Trump and Peña Nieto called off their own meeting in January.
